intro: Lagarinthus multicaulis, commonly known as the clustered lantana, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to violet, often attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
